name: Luteren
description:
Very flat and open canyon, but due to the high waterflow it is quite technical.

Approach

The first waterfall can be seen immediatly from the bridge.

Descent

The first section starts with a dangerous pool and a natural arch which both haven't been abseiled through. Then another small 3 Meter step. Walk for a about 300m, then comes a 5m Fall which can be downclimbed and jumped (the last 2 meters). Again a few minutes of walking, and you'll get to the last section made of 2 Waterfalls, the first one could be done as a jump if the current isn't too strong.

Exit

Exit on the right side and walk up to the road.

Red tape

Beta sites

Trip reports and media

Background

The river has a water level measurement. First descent was done at 500L/s, but sometimes the flow goes down to 150, so it should be possible to go through the arch.
